weaponProfile.title: Big Bertha
weaponProfile.specialAbility: Fires a grenade that deals massive explosive damage in a huge radius and is guaranteed to knock down all affected enemies. The grenade also releases a short-lived EMP burst on detonation, disabling nearby electronics and cyberware.

keyRelationships.nemesis: Commander Kenjiro 'The Oni' Tanaka (Arasaka | Cyber-Ops Division). Tanaka was the Arasaka officer in charge of the vault during the 'Scorched Earth Heist.' The blast from 'Big Bertha' tore off his cybernetic arm and fried his optics, leaving him scarred and disgraced. Now a high-ranking cyborg with a personal vendetta, he is obsessed with recovering the weapon and personally dismantling the Animal who wielded it, viewing it as a crude insult to Arasaka's technological superiority.
keyRelationships.creator: The Forgemasters of the Animals

legendaryOrigin.objective: A crew of Animals, led by a legendary breacher named 'Bull,' was hired for an impossible task: breach a subterranean Arasaka vault in City Center.
legendaryOrigin.outcome: A legendary failure and a catastrophic success. 'Bull,' armed with a master-crafted Rhino he called 'Big Bertha,' did the impossible: he blew a hole in the Arasaka vault door. However, the resulting explosion was far greater than anticipated, igniting a secondary gas line and causing a massive underground firestorm that destroyed the data shard and everything else in the vault. The Arasaka commander, Tanaka, was maimed in the blast. 'Bull' was the only member of his crew to escape the inferno, his weapon now infamous.
legendaryOrigin.mercFate: 'Bull's' entire crew was lost in the firestorm. 'Bull' himself became a ghost, a disgraced Animal on the run from both Arasaka and his own gang, who blamed him for the failed gig. He was last seen trying to fence 'Big Bertha' for a ticket out of the city.
legendaryOrigin.mercFeedback: 'The seismic sensors lit up the whole district. We didn't know what it was. A quake? A bomb? The Arasaka vault was... gone. Not opened. Erased. And in the middle of the wreckage, one survivor, screaming about a 'demon with a cannon.' It wasn't a heist; it was a catastrophe.' - NCPD Incident Report.
legendaryOrigin.reputationImpact: This event turned 'Big Bertha' into a legend, the gun that blew a hole in Arasaka's unbreachable fortress. It became a symbol of the Animals' terrifying, unpredictable power. It also created a bitter and powerful enemy in Commander Tanaka, a man who now dedicates his life to hunting the weapon that cost him his arm and his honor.

designAndMaterials.materials: The chassis of 'Big Bertha' is a heavily reinforced Militech Mk. 31 grenade launcher, stolen and stripped down. The barrel is a custom-forged, thick-walled steel tube designed to withstand the immense pressure of its custom grenades. The stock is welded steel, wrapped in scarred, blood-stained leather.
designAndMaterials.ammunitionType: Uses a unique, hand-packed 40mm HEC (High-Energy Concussive) grenade. The warhead contains a massive charge of low-fragmentation explosive and a powdered graphite compound. Upon detonation, the graphite is aerosolized, creating a powerful, short-range EMP burst that fries most commercial-grade cyberware.

compatibleMods.description: This unique, dangerously sensitive trigger mechanism slightly reduces the weapon's firing delay. It is a master-crafted but notoriously unsafe modification that is the signature of its original, disgraced owner.

weaponPhilosophy.concept: The Rhino is the physical embodiment of the Animals' core belief: there is no obstacle that cannot be broken. It is not a weapon of subtlety or grace; it is a tool of overwhelming, catastrophic force. Its philosophy is that a locked door, a fortified wall, or a line of heavily armored enemies are all just temporary problems waiting for a permanent solution. The Rhino is that solution. It is the first, last, and only word in any argument about access.

manufacturingIntel.creatorReputation: The Animals don't have 'gunsmiths'; they have 'forgemasters.' 'Big Bertha' is a unique masterwork, a one-of-a-kind creation that was the result of a legendary breacher's desperate ingenuity.
manufacturingIntel.developmentHistory: 'Big Bertha' is a legend. The other 'Rhinos' used by the Animals are attempts to replicate its devastating power, but they lack the perfectly balanced (and dangerously potent) custom grenades and the raw, historical significance of the original. After its catastrophic success, the Animals' forgemasters were never able to perfectly replicate the chemical compound that gave 'Big Bertha' its infamous kick.

strengths: Unmatched crowd control, capable of knocking down and disabling an entire squad with a single shot.
The ultimate breaching tool, capable of destroying most doors and environmental cover.
The added EMP burst is devastating against cyborgs, drones, and netrunners.
Excellent for initiating combat and creating mass chaos.
weaknesses: Abysmally slow reload speed, leaving the user completely defenseless after firing.
The grenade's trajectory is a slow, parabolic arc, making it difficult to hit moving targets.
The massive blast radius makes it extremely dangerous to use in close quarters.
Possession of this weapon makes you the personal enemy of the high-ranking Arasaka cyborg, Commander Tanaka.
tacticalAssessment.recommendedRoles: Breacher, Heavy Gunner, Demolitions Expert, Crowd Control.
tacticalAssessment.masteryArchetype: A 'Point-Man' build. A solo with a high Body attribute and cyberware that enhances explosive resistance and reload speed. The ideal user is the first one through the door... or the one who *makes* the door. They kick off a fight by firing 'Big Bertha' into a packed room, then switch to a shotgun or LMG to clean up the dazed and scattered survivors. They don't engage in fights; they start them, with a bang.

acquisitionIntel.marketAvailability: Unique. This weapon is a piece of infamous history and cannot be bought.
acquisitionIntel.rumoredLocation: After the disgraced Animal, 'Bull,' went on the run, he reportedly tried to sell the weapon to Muamar 'El Capitán' Reyes to fund his escape from the city. El Capitán, recognizing its legendary status and the heat attached to it, is said to have 'acquired' it for a very low price. He now keeps it locked in his private armory, a trophy of immense power that is too dangerous to use and too valuable to sell.

crewSynergyAssessment.analysis: Big Bertha is the ultimate 'alpha strike' weapon for a crew that believes in shock and awe. Its user is the battering ram, the one who starts the fight by literally blowing a hole in the enemy's defense. A successful strategy is built around this opening move. A netrunner can use Ping to identify the most densely packed group of enemies, giving the Bertha's user a perfect target. After the initial blast stuns and disables the survivors, a fast-moving solo or bladedancer can rush in to clean up with devastating efficiency. Its role is to be the thunderclap that stuns the enemy, allowing the lightning to strike.
